H0.text: Stanislaw August Poniatowski was the last king of which European country. Lithuania

H1.text: Stanislaw August Poniatowski was the last king of which European country. Russia

H2.text: Stanislaw August Poniatowski was the last king of which European country. Hungary

H3.text: Stanislaw August Poniatowski was the last king of which European country. Polnd

A4.text: The royal election of 1764 resulted in the elevation of Stanisław II Augustus Poniatowski to the monarchy.

A5.text: Stanisław II August (born Stanisław Antoni Poniatowski; 17 January 1732 – 12 February 1798), known also by his regnal Latin name Stanislaus II Augustus, and as Stanisław August Poniatowski (Lithuanian: Stanislovas Augustas Poniatovskis), was King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania from 1764 to 1795, and the last monarch of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth.
